line_1: But hold — I feel my Gout decrease,
line_2: And Truths which wou'd disturb my Peace

line_1: And as the Fuel sinks, the Flame decrease:
line_2: Mov'd by my Charms, with them your Love may cease,

line_1: Thy charms will every day decrease,
line_2: Then boast not, Flavia, thy fair face,

line_1: His ruddy health with length of years decrease:
line_2: His silver forehead with the wreath of peace:
The world, I ween, may rest in peace;

line_1: Your Charms will ev'ry Day decrease,
line_2: Then boast, fair Flavia, boast your Face,

line_1: The Winds fall silent; and the Waves decrease:
line_2: The Dove brings Quiet, and the Olive Peace:
